{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents mention that an extra root in the mandibular first molar can be either a radix entomolaris or a radix paramolaris. The difference between the two lies in their location. A radix entomolaris is located distolingually, while a radix paramolaris is located mesiobuccally. Therefore, an extra distal root in the mandibular first molar is known as a radix entomolaris.", "answer_choice": "B. Radix entomolaris"}
